result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul W Gierach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Consecutive to: any other sentence Defendant may be serving.

miscConds.notes:
$1,242 fine imposed in 15-CM-621 shall be paid as a condition of probation in 15-CM-1078 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul W Gierach

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Def appears in custody & w/Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Resolution reached; defense free to argue.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Argument by counsel.  Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.
Per request of Atty. Michael Kenitz, case calendared for 11-16-15 at 9:45 a.m. to be brought in with Br. 3 case 15-CM-621 for anticipated resolution.
Def in person & by Atty Mike Kenitz.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State. Hope to resolve case in Br 3  Hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State. Atty Kenitz anticipates being retained but has not yet been; atty unavailable to appear today. Def still anticipates retaining Atty Kentiz.  Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred DeJunco of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Def represented by Atty Kenitz on other cases and def intends to retain him on this matter as well.  Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
